intro: Silene chodatii, commonly known as the Chodat's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring or early summer. Silene chodatii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, desert scrub, and along canyon walls.
